Reviews.Title: “very nice, perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MishelSofia
Reviews.Content: very nice property in the heart of the old city, but not noisy. Location close to the attractions in the old city and close to tram stop. The breakfast room (restaurant) has a beautiful view. Staff friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS SO GOOD”
Reviews.Author: labida
Reviews.Content: The best location ever. Since I work in tourism, do you rate this hotel as a very good choice. Hotels in the city include the type of small rooms, it is intended for a few nights sleep, I have no objection. An excellent and rich breakfast. Information would be useful to the introduction of our new smoking laws have no right to light a cigar absolutely anywhere, even in restaurants. But what to do. And nothing is more expensive in passion outside of the consumer, due to be paid what you are looking, and I now Istanbul is one of the most beautiful cities I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheWingco
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best value boutique hotel in Sultanhamet. Excellent service, good value restaurant, amazing view from the terrace, convenient location. Special mention for Ali, the duty manager, who used his initiative when we had a problem with a transfer company who couldn't be bothered to confirm our return pick-up time: he arranged an alternative that was 30TL cheaper than our original quote. And we got complimentary coffee whilst waiting for our 5.30am pick-up. As for the contributor who complained about the TV service not being good - what on earth did you go to Istanbul for?

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1animalfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the staff is friendly. It is walking distance to the Grand Bazar and close to all the local attractions like the Blue Mosque. I have saved the shampoo from this hotel just so that I remembered to rate it and mention it on my web page. I felt it was a great find. I stayed here about 6 years or so ago. The shampoo will finally be thrown away. I found the price very fair at that time. I hope it has stayed as such.

Reviews.Title: “Four Nights in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a quiet location but is still close to many of the tourist attractions of Istanbul. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Bedrooms are comfortable. Breakfast food is good with plenty of choice, complemented by good views from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked - lied about excuse - had to spend next night there”
Reviews.Author: insearchofit
Reviews.Content: Part of package - 2 night. Arrived 4pm told room too cold - what!! - stupid excuse for overbooking. Passed over to another hotel which was very good. Tried to stay there for the second night - told ok to stay there, but when we returned to this other hotel - were told we had to move back. A bit of a pain repacking but not far away and the hotel is ok. Many better around this location - BEST AREA TO STAY IN ISTANBUL. Good view from upstairs, breakfast ok, staff ok - all average - cant complain except for the overbooking.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: intrepid_uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mina is located in the Sultahnamet area of the city, about 5 mins walk from the tram stop. Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace all within walking distance. Our room was average - comfortable bed and nice view over the city. The TV didn't work very well. Breakfast was also average and choices were fairly limited (pastries, toast, cereal, tinned fruit). Hotel staff were not particularly friendly - the atmosphere was fairly cold in general. In summary, adequte as a place to sleep and a good base for exploring the city - but don't expect any added frills!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ale3andro
Reviews.Content: Generally the Mina Hotel is a very good choice if you plan a trip in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is just excellent. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi and the Grand Market (Capali Carsi) are within walking distance. The room was small but very clean. Unfortunately there was a problem with the telephone shower but besides that no other problem. The breakfast is good with a big variety of things to choose from and the stuff friendly. If you find a good offer then book it without a second thought, but in its regular price range I think that you can find a better hotel in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Meester44
Reviews.Content: Our cruise ended in Istanbul and we spent three nights at the Hotel Mina before flying home. Great location, nice but small rooms, clean, helpful staff. Staff recommended nearby restaurants where the locals eat, which we all enjoyed. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: KOtheConsultant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mina in November 2011 and was very pleased with the location, the rooms, breakfast and the staff. You can walk to virtually all of the main sites and there is a good selection of restaurants, bars and hookah places around the hotel. My tips for this hotel are to get a room near the front of the bulding and to take the train/subway from the airport if you are looking to save a few bucks. The train is very safe and stops a block away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krismile
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice view from restaurant, clean. Small rooms, slow internet. Good breakfast, but should be a little bit more fruits. Close to many sightseeings.The main impression - is friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: MelanieMac_1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place to stay with an exceptional location. The service is hit-or-miss from the staff but it is very clean and the bed was comfortable. The cleaning people were more than adequate but the front desk staff and the rooftop bar staff were randomly available. We detoured from our originally intended dinner one night on the misguided recommendation of the gentleman at the front desk- avoid this and any restaurant that offers free pick-up service. The rooftop bar/ breakfast room is a nice place to check out the view. The food is average for breakfast, but free so it is definitely more than worth the money. This hotel is comparable to a quaint Comfort Inn in a great location, not a Four Seasons. The shampoo & soap are provided, just not the fancy kind you want to sneak home in your bag. The noise during the call to prayers is loud throughout the hotel as you are surrounded by mosques, but I generally slept right through it after walking all day. For the price, this place is a perfect spot- clean, honest, and comfortable. Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mina - location location location”
Reviews.Author: Adelina I
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 9 nights and found it to be in the perfect location! all the main attractions - Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque were just minutes away. Tram line was also very near. Rooms were small but clean - we weren't planning to stay in the room and miss out on the city's attraction anyway! only reservation was the breakfast buffet - which was the same everyday . Small matter though since there were plenty of small cafes all around the hotel. I would definitely go there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “At the Center of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth J
Reviews.Content: Location is close to the history of the old city. The Blue Mosque is just across around the corner. The 6th floor breakfast was one of the best in terms of light selections to start your day. I stayed in a single bed and king bed on my visit to the city and found they very comfortable, even if at first they may look as if they are not. So, base yourself at Mina Hotel and walk the city. And, thanks to a good staff that takes care of your needs, but you never see them. This is definitely my home in the city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_McL
Reviews.Content: A superb location, just a few minutes walk from the most attractions and very good out of season rates. Rooms are small, but well equipped with superb bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in So Many Ways”
Reviews.Author: Redfanjan
Reviews.Content: After staying at the MIna Hotel, we put it on our lists of favorites. It is within walking distance of so many attractions including the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, the tram, and many, many good restaurants. It also is near a commercial street (with the tram) where it is easy to experience excellent street food with the locals. A turkish bath is within three blocks of the hotel and a recommended experience. The staff at the Mina Hotel were extremely nice. They made sure we had everything we needed. We felt very welcomed each time we entered the hotel. The breakfast was wonderful in a room with a view of the sunrise over the water. Background music changed daily at breakfast, but always added such a nice touch as it was not intrusive. We would return and can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location top.”
Reviews.Author: jhabluetzel
Reviews.Content: We've been in Hotel Mina from 10.Nov -15.Nov 2011 Don't forget a Turkey dictionaire when you travel to Istanbul. Rooms are small, but very clean, wireless only oke in the restaurant, in the rooms not able (no signal), Breakfast very good but in the restaurant typical TÃ¼rkey menu, nothing international, could be much better. We've had a room in the 5.floor, with a small window. Service personal helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: 1Worldwalker
Reviews.Content: Spent our last night in Turkey at the Hotel Mina. Great location only a couple of blocks from the tram and a few blocks from the Grand Bazaar for last minute shopping. Rooms are average in size, clean, well appointed. Some on upper floors have view of the water and mosque. Rooftop restarant, terrace and bar have great views. Service was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kungful
Reviews.Content: Small, but clean rooms with a friendly staff and a great location to see the sights from. The rooftop has excellent views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Udayan P
Reviews.Content: Great location and comfortable, clean room. We walked to all the major attractions even though the tram service is just a couple of minutes away. The rooftop bar has awesome views of the city and especially the Blue Mosque. The staff at the reception is top-notch. They are extremely helpful, courteous and genuinely helped us out.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: zasar
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel good staff service, room a little small. Breakfast was okay but overall had no major issues

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raropt
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location enabling you to explore all the great attractions. Found the rooms small but surprisingly comfortable. In our room the bathroom door had to be shut with a bit of force to get past the basin :) Fantastic roof top bar! After a day exploring a nice cold beer on the roo top looking out of the city was Perfect Overall very happy! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dorat_11
Reviews.Content: We booked at Mina Hotel two double rooms, for 4 nights at an average price of 70 Euro pr room, per night. The hotel offers a one way free pick up service from the airport. The car we travelled with on our way with the pick up service was a very confortable minivan. The driver put up us some turkish music during the ride. On the arrival, the staff was very friendly and gave us all informations we needed for our stay. Don't forget to ask for a reduction of 8% on the total price, when you pay cash. We were given two rooms on the second floor (the hotel has an elevator) which were looking on the street and had big windows. The air conditioning worked very well. The room ws very clean, but in fact a bit small. Then we went for a tee on the terrace, where there is a wonderful view of the city, including the Blue Mosque...breathtaking. The prices of the menu are reasonable, you pay around 3 Turkish lira for a tee and 5 Turkish lira for a Turkish coffe, 7 Turkish lira for a beer. Near the hotel there are places where you can have dinner for 10 Turkish lira per person, like Caffe' Vento just around the corner. We were there during Ramadan and they were offering Iftar Menu'. To go to the main square, you turn left when out form the hotel and follow the road down to reach the Blue Mosque. The bufet breakfast was ok, only thet the burek finished and after it finished they put fried chips to substitute it, so you have to go and have breakfast early in order to eat burek. There is a vast selection of cheese, one of them very salty. Everything is at a walking distance. You will enjoy your stay there. The person who cleanes the rooms is a male, that was strange, but he was a very nuce man, he gave me an umbrella one day when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3* by European standards”
Reviews.Author: EmmanuelBologna
Reviews.Content: All the staff is extremely helpful. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are in good condition and of an average size (not too small). The bathrooms are nice and spacious. Breakfast has a good selection. The roof top bar is great for a drink in the afternoon and in the evening, overlooking the sea. I advise to spend a few extra Euros/Dollars and take a Marmara room, so that you have a view over the sea in the morning when you pull the curtains open. I went to this hotel expecting a 3*, and it was an extremely good 3*, by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of the old city”
Reviews.Author: RiaAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 2nd time this year. Its a nice hotel, not expensive and really very good located. The room is not very big but clean, bed was good and every day fresh bedlinnen and towels. At night the neighbourhood is quiet, even in Ramadan. The view from the terrace is so very nice!! Breakfast is ok, but the temparature in the restaurant was a bit too warm. I didnt have dinner in the hotel, i think they can do better with the menu. But overall, its nice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sudasgup
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at the Mina Hotel, during our first visit to Istanbul. Had booked two adjoining "family rooms" , which though quite small, were very comfortable - but no views at all, being on the ground floor. The hotel is very centrally located, and all historic sites in the the old city are within walking distance. Additionally, the tram line is barely a 3 minute walk away. Foodies, and shopaholics (for traditional Turkish goods), will be spoilt for choice - the area around is a delight. Coming back to the hotel - the service was consistently warm and personal( the manager , Mr.Ali, merits special mention). Lounging around late evening on the stunning rooftop terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque (360 degrees view), or having breakfast in the rooftop restaurant , were unforgettable experiences. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reception Staff & Breakfasts, But...”
Reviews.Author: MargaretGargoyle
Reviews.Content: Eight days at the Mina - the reception staff were really friendly and exceptionally helpful. They went out of their way to assist my successful purchasing of a ticket to se the Venice Baroque Orchestra at St Eirene. The hotel is close to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. The breakfasts were a terrific spread of traditional Turkish food (after all, one is in Turkey) and the breakfast room has a glorious view. The breakfast staff were a bit too keen whipping your plate away before you have quite finished eating. I had booked and prepaid for a double bed but my request for a quiet room meant swapping that booking for twin singles. My room on the 2nd floor was situated in a firetrap cul-de-sac in this elderly hotel building. I was concerned to see fixed no-escape iron bars across the windows. The modern fibreglass shower bath was an interesting challenge as the actual side of the bath was so high that it was quite dangerous stepping in and out of the bath. Pleased I travel with a small rubber bath mat! The Ottoman house adjoining my bedhead wall was being loudly demolished over that entire week and at one stage something like a battering ram hit the wall behind my head and dislodged the actual bedhead close to my head. I have previously stayed close to the Hagia Sophia and would look for accommodation in that area on my next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: CrisabRomania
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, although the rooms are quite small. The staff was very nice and polite, helping us with useful advice all the time. The hotel was very well located and in a quiet area, so the sleep was very good. Very close to important locations, like Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. Many restaurants around. The view from the restaurant on top floor was wonderful and it was a pleasure to breakfast every day; a good breakfast for my tastes. I will come back again, as this hotel is good quality for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, ambience, value. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRobo
Reviews.Content: We were 19 people on a business trip for 2/3 nights and were delighted our knowledgeable local agent (highly recommended too) had chosen such an appropriate and good hotel for us. The staff were friendly and attentive to our needs, the hotel location is very central so no need for transport to get around and the roof terrace views are spectacular. 13 colleagues joined us for drinks and dinner on the roof terrace one night (it easliy accommodated our party of 32 and other hotel guests) and the staff organised the event effortlessly. The bedrooms come in different sizes, are fine for short stays and come fully equipped with the usual amenities, eg minibar, flat screen TV, hairdryer, complimentary bathroom products. The food is good and there's plenty of it. All in all, highly recommend for anyone visiting the centre of Istanbul and who appreciates excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!”
Reviews.Author: ImpactFacilities
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a three day stay on the 2nd June 2011. The first room that we were allocated was a very small double room that had a single high level window.There was not enough room to move around once we got our cases in. We had specifically requested a twin and after some discussion they moved us to a twin room with a window that opened onto a wall less than half a metre away. It was larger than the the first room, we reluctantly accepted it. After the porter left we noticed a strong smell of urine emanating from between the beds. We summoned Housekeeping who appeared with a very strong smelling spray that eventually obscured the urine smell. We decided to stay and see how it went. Housekeeping sprayed the room a bit later for good measure. We went out and had a meal in town, then when we returned later we found a big pool of water in the middle of the bathroom floor. The duty porter came up and investigated and explained that it was a leaking tap, which could not be repaired until the morning. He left a pile of clean towels under the wash basin to absorb the leaking water. Not very satisfactory. The bath was high sided and was made a good four inches higher than usual by the shower door frame surmounting it. An elderly person or person with a slight mobility problem would have had difficulty in getting into the bath or the shower. We were not asked whether we had any mobility problems at the time of booking and were not aware of the high sided bath issue? The first morning the wash basin plug stuck in the plug hole with the basin full of water that I had shaved in. The reception was notified and the plumber would repair it at the same time the leaking tap was repaired. That evening we returned and noted that the repairs had been carried out. Sadly when we used the wash basin the plug got jammed in again. We asked for it to be sorted out properly that night. The porter arrived with a small screw driver and after some tinkering stated that it would have to wait until the morning which we said was unacceptable. I then stripped out the offending plug mechanism, getting drenched in the process but managed to get the plug working as a temporary fix. The Reception promised to get it repaired properly the next morning. We told them that tomorrow was not good enough. In the event I ended up shaving using running water which was a bit of a waste but "needs must". The breakfast is a Turkish buffet, any English Breakfast items are charged extra as is fresh fruit juice. Overall the hotel was dark and dingy. The location is good but that is about it! Unfortunately this is not a hotel that we would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and frinedly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ourdream2
Reviews.Content: Great location 5 minutes walk to the Grand Bazzar and many other historic and traditional places in Sultanahmet. The breakfast is buffet and it's good not too bad. The staff very friendly and always trying to help. The only disadvantage we faced is that there is no wireless internet in the rooms, only in the looby.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay....”
Reviews.Author: backpacker1234
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the heart of of the historic centre of istanbul. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.rooms extremely clean and breakfast was more than adequate.would definitely recommend this to yoing couples. Make sure u check out the terrace for breathtaking views of the city and the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: karnat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mina Hotel for three nights in the begginning of May. It was a very pleasurable experience, which started from the arrival at the Ataturk airport. We ordered an airport transfer with Mina and the driver patiently waited for extra 2 hours as our flight was delayed. We were taken to the hotel in a spacious, cream color leather-seats van. As we entered the lobby, the receptionist greeted us by name (they coordinated with their drivers the arrival of their guests). Small gesture but it showed their attention to details. We received our keys, city tour tips and map and were escorted to the room without the delay. The staff was always helpful and ready to answer any questions. The room was nice - it really does look as they show it on hotel web-site. No suprises. There was enough space in the room, no complains here. Our room faced the street but it was not too noisy - you can hear a call for prayer, of course, but you can hear it anywhere in Istanbul. Mina has very comfortable beds and very soft bedding. The bathroom had a bathtub and complimentary toiletries, towels and sheets were changed daily. The restaurant on the 6th floor is rather small in size, but provides a spectacular view of the Bosphorus and decent breakfast selection. The rooftop terrace was also lovely place to enjoy breakfast at, however, beware of seaguls! If you leave your plate to go get smth from the restaurant again, you may come back to a plate missing some sausage! Those birds are not shy :) The terrace, against our expectations, was rather big - it went all around the roof of the hotel building. The view was wonderful, of course. The hotel is conveniently located at the Sultanahmet region of Istanbul and all the major tourist attractions were basically 5-10 minutes walking away. We enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and at Mina hotel very much and would recommend it for others

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ancytotravel
Reviews.Content: We spent about 6 days in Istanbul and adored each day. A city that is hustle and bustle can ware on you, so the Mina was a wonderful place- quiet, lovely food and nice room. Hamidullah, the restaurant manager has become a friend for life. The location is super for seeing the hotspots...don't miss nearby bakeries! Have a cup of tea on the roof- one of the best views of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harkolino
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days in June 2008 in this hotel, together with my wife... After we arrived, very kind receptionist welcomed us, and provided us with basic informations about hotel and the city. After we took our keycard, they took our luggage and carry it in our room. Very nice and kind personnel, always eager to help. The room was nice, kind of small, but clean and nice, with everything you need... air conditioning, mini bar, coffee maker... every day, they clean th room, and provide new clean towels... We were on B&B there, and since we love to sleep little bit longer, we ate breakfest at their restaurant on the top of the hotel only once. Restaurant is small but cute. Breakfast was nice, great choice of everything, from butter to different kinds of salami, bread and cheerios... Coffee, milk and tee included of course. Hotel itself, got really, really great postition, it is located in the old part of the city, Sultanahmet. Tram, bank, post office, grand bazaar, underground cistern, Topkapi museum... everything is 5 minutes walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel that I'd visit it again in the future”
Reviews.Author: HARISAEK21
Reviews.Content: i liked this hotel a lot.the reception was perfect, the room good but not spacey( no 208 or 209 i think.also the management should think to put a brush in the toilet for the ...you know... there was no brush.a last thing that i d like to say is that the staff of the restaurant wasnt very smiley with you if you didnt leave a tip.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to come back to”
Reviews.Author: Aariz17
Reviews.Content: Lets start from the reception every one Was fluent in English and were very helpful.Next the room.The room was good was well equipped and clean but was small in size. The breakfast Was excellent the service was fantastic The view from the restaurant was wonderful. The location of the hotel was extremely ideal most of the tourist spots shops restaurants Subways, tramways etc. were very close by.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PTFrasers
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 2 kids (4 and 8) at Mina in room 702, which oddly enough is on the ground floor behind reception-- there are 6 other floors. The room was very clean and nicely furnished although small with the two kids. We had no view from our room. Walls are a bit thin so we could hear our neighbors some, but it wasn't a big issue. The hotel is in a great location for seeing a lot of major sites on foot and is very near public transportation as well. Staff was generally attentive and welcoming and they all spoke some degree of English. The breakfast buffet was quite a spread with something for everyone and a wonderful view out onto the entrance to the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rossoangel
Reviews.Content: Really, very friendly personal. On reception and restoran, they ready to help you if you need something. Clear room. Good view from restoran. Thank you Ali for my shoos ))

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: odykoko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old quarter of Istanbul-it is short walk to all the tourist spots.The rooms are small but clean-breakfast is buffet style and delicious.The view from the breakfast area is fantastic.Reception staff are ready to answer any questions you have about the area.We would definitely go back to the Hotel Mina again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, very good price!”
Reviews.Author: SasiAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet, near to Agia Sophia, blue mosque and Topkapi. Although is a central hotel is very peaceful and quiet! Beautiful view from the breakfast area! Nice and clean rooms. The only disadvantage is the absence of parking area, but fortunately we found one quite near. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: bunty027
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel by email and everything worked well. We were met at the airport and taken straight to the hotel. We were greeted by friendly, efficient staff and this professionalism was throughout the hotel - everyone wanting to make your stay the best it could be. Arriving late in the evening we had a snack in the restaurant and had our first glimpse of Istanbul from the rooftop - wow! The hotel is in a superb position for the main sights, restaurants etc. and is maintained to a very high standard. I took the opportunity to see some of the other rooms (double rooms have walk-in showers) and would have no hesitation in recommending the ones facing the street - they have large windows that open onto small balconies. We had chosen a Marmara room (at a small extra charge) with sea view - 5th. floor, under the restaurant. While the twin beds were really comfortable and the room kept very clean- despite a previous guest disobeying the no-smoking rule -yuk!!-, the 'hike' into the bathtub was difficult. The room was very warm and we kept the window open at night - The Mosque is situated opposite these rooms and the call to prayer at around 6 am. ensures that you don't miss a single minute of daytime in this beautiful city!! We will definitely return to Istanbul and will stay here again - thank you Ali and team.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution.”
Reviews.Author: R Ramey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one weeks stay at the Mina. Everything there is done on the cheap. The rooms are run down and seen much better days. The breakfast of olives, tomatoes, bologne, cheese and yesterday's bread was not appealing to say the least. The welcome fruit basket was this: A small breakfast plate with one apple, one plum, one fig and one banana with an 8 ounce bottle of red wine that tasted like lighter fluid. And this was for two people. On checkout we had a hassle over an $80.00 overcharge even though we had the managers email's on our side. Finally after 3 early morning phone calls the bill was resolved in our favor and with many apologies for our troubles and we were allowed to catch our cab. Oh, there was the "free dinner for two" included. Not off the regular menu, no sirreee. It was the standard rubber chicken, rice and a glob of something we didn't know what it was. Anyway, the Mina Hotel was the low-point of our trip to Istanbul. Other than that the city was beautiful and the people friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Retirada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 201 at the Hotel Mina in October/November 2010, and enjoyed it very much, The room was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet delicious and the location very convenient. I booked on the hotel's web site, and received a discount for a long stay, free dinner, and a free shuttle from the hotel back to the airport. I highly recommend the Mina Hotel and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: margasuvaal
Reviews.Content: mina is a great hotel. The first night we stayed in the marmaris room with twin beds. Small room, big bathroom, great vieuw. The other night we were moved to the streetsite, bigger room, small bath room, bus the the receptionist said, you do not stay all day in the bathroom. The location is great, breakfast is sufficient, and the vieuw from the terrace is great. Service is good and the people helpfull and friendly! We had a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: kumquattraveller
Reviews.Content: Mina Boutique hotel was excellent value for money. It was in an excellent location just a minutes walk to Divan Yolu which is a long street full of restaurants, travel agents and much more. It's within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and tram stops. Breakfast was basic but had good views. Breakfast staff were very friendly and efficient. Receptionist had good English and was helpful. We stayed at the Best Western Acropol as well in Istanbul and although its rooms were much nicer, they were also much pricier! Mina Boutique is better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The way a hotel should be...!”
Reviews.Author: Travelvirus2010
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul, where I stayed in Mina Hotel in Sultanahmet. The service was great, very polite staff. Friendly and helpfull and speak English quite good. Rooms are clean. They have standard double bedrooms, if you wish a triple room they put an extra bed in the room. I wouldn't advice this, cause its to narrow. Just go for two rooms, it doesnt differ much in price. Location is perfect, near some of the best sights.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: deniz1973
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many tourist hotels in major european cities, we have found the Mina Hotel to be truly excellent. The location, within five minutes of all the major attractions of Sultanahmet was superb. The 360 degree view from the terrace bar was truly magnificent during day and night. Reception was extremely helpfull, the waiting staff pleasant and amiable, and the cleaning standard was as good as any five star hotel we have visited. There was plenty of choice for an adequate breakfast and alternaties were available for a very reasonable price. We hope to visit the Mina again next year. Susan Aston and Deniz Erdogan

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bishfamily
Reviews.Content: A clean, friendly, efficient hotel in a great location in Istanbul. The hotel has a lovely rooftop restaurant where you can take breakfast or have dinner. The buffet breakfast choice is wide but the dinner menu is disappointingly limited - after the first night we ate out, despite the fantastic view from the rooftop. The room was small but satisfactory, overall a good hotel for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable hotel of consistant high quality”
Reviews.Author: suejagger
Reviews.Content: I was careful in selecting a hotel for our 3 day stay in Istanbul. In addition to taking my unwilling husband I was also taking my elderly parents. My overworked husband was sorted in 24 hours with a very relaxing wind down in house massage. My mother had an accident in the streets of the city, and the hotel staff were most attentive, arranging room service. I had selected this hotel because the standard seemed good, and more importantly in was located in the Sultanmet district which made getting around easy for parents. My only criticism was that the air conditioning was a little slow to cool the room, but we still had very comfortable nights there. I had not told the family of the view from the roof terrace bar, and arriving late afternoon, I took them up there. My husband was immediately won over, we felt instantly transported to another land. My 85 year old father wants to return, and if he did it solo, I would feel completely happy to have him base himself at this friendly establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mazandra
Reviews.Content: This hotel although small was in a very good position for all the main tourist attractions - we walked to most. The room was small but clean and adequate with a lovely view of the Bosphorus. We did eat in the restaurant one evening and found it disappointing. The reception staff - Gokhan and Caner - were friendly and very helpful. When I returned to the UK I discovered that I had been charged twice for a trip booked through the Mina Hotel. The staff responded to my emails and several weeks later due to their efforts, the money was returned to my credit card. Well done for that extra service guys. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Marion & Fran

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: HUNTERCHERTSEYSURREY
Reviews.Content: Just returned to UK after six nights at The Mina-excellent value,helpful staff with a good command of english.Room was clean and functional.Our only complaint was with regard to the food in the restaurant.We had been given a 15% discount voucher on arrival but the menu and the food were both bland,so we did not eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff, and terrace views”
Reviews.Author: Sky201008
Reviews.Content: The Mina Hotel is within very easy walking distance of most sites we wished to see, from the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, and Yerebatan Cistern in one direction to the Grand Bazaar in another. The location alone is outstanding, but the staff is also very friendly and extremely helpful, making our stay very pleasant. By American standards, the room we stayed in was small and not the most up-to-date in terms of decor, although we liked the real marble countertop in the bathroom. The room would probably rate 2 or 3 stars in the US. However, when I travel, I spend most of my time exploring outside the hotel and only need a clean, comfortable, safe place to sleep at night. The Mina Hotel is a perfect base from which to explore beautiful Istanbul. My friend and I loved staying at the Mina and would happily stay there again if we return to Istanbul. In addition to the location and staff, we loved the spectacular view from the rooftop terrace restaurant. It is easily one of the best views of Istanbul, facing the sea but including the Blue Mosque and a panoramic view of modern parts of the city as well. It's a great place to relax in the evening as the sun sets and the lights come on along the water. When it is time for a call to prayer, you can hear the call from different mosques throughout the city float up to the terrace. (Because there is a mosque next to the hotel, you may hear a loud call/chant at night if your room happens to face the mosque). There is also free internet access for hotel guests. Overall, the Mina Hotel offers terrific value and service to its guests. We liked the people and the location very much and have very good memories of our time in Istanbul. One neighborhood note: try the potato guzelme (pancakes/crepes), made fresh from scratch to order, at the Asli kebap place next to the hotel. The place is run by two brothers and a sister, who were some of our favorite people we met in Istanbul. Also, check out the small information cards in the lounge area of the hotel. You may find free entrance cards to sites or discounts to nearby restaurants. In response to another traveler's complaint: The abundant breakfast buffet does include an orange beverage that resembles Tang. If you don't like Tang, freshly squeezed real orange juice is available at an extra cost. Otherwise, the fresh breads, great variety of cheeses, fruits, eggs, and other offerings are a good way to start the day. The menu for dinner has reasonable prices compared to other similar restaurants in the area. We think it's fine, especially given the quality of the service and the amazing view from the terrace. The food is simple and satisfying. If you want cheaper food, there is a McDonald's nearby as well as other diner-type places. Or if you would like very fine exquisite dining, we recommend Asitane, which specializes in dishes made from recipes drawn from 16th-19th century royal Ottoman kitchens.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel, great location, staff & roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Cressida12345
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, walking distance from the tram and many of Istanbul's most popular sights (Blue Mosque etc.) Very helpful staff, prepared to help organise transport and meals for groups, as well as everyday little issues. Rooms very well equipped and clean. Lovely bathrooms, powerful shower and aircon. Beautiful roof terrace with bar and cafe/restaurant, fantastic views over the city - a really nice place to relax. Very few negatives: Breakfast room was a little crowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort and service at an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ESVwestsussex
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed at the Mina, while visiting Istanbul for a wedding. The rooms were clean, cool and comfortable, affording an excellent nights sleep, pillows and mattresses of a very high standard. The roof-terrace, with its spectacular and romantic views was a great place for us to meet up and relax over a drink and was popular with us all. The location was ideal as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar and other Sultanahmet attractions were only a few minutes walk away, as were a varied and large number of places to eat and drink. What makes this hotel stand out though is the staff. Every individual we encountered was polite and friendly while doing their job enthusiastically and to the highest standard. Ali on the front desk dealt with our miriad of requests with imagination and a "can do" attitude, never giving us the impression that we were being difficult or demanding. He took requests for flowers, hairdressers, zip-repairs as much in his stride as the more mundane ones for taxis and logistics and always came up with an answer. We plan to return to the Mina and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: peacefulexplorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three nights at Hotel Mina in May 2010 as part of a two week trip. We were very pleased with Hotel Mina in all aspects. The staff were very helpful, the location of the hotel is terrific (particularly for those who want to explore Older parts of Istanbul in Sultanahment), the rooms are quite nice (although small) and the view on the rooftap bar is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: WFDScotland
Reviews.Content: Rooms comfortable but air con kept going off. Shower good, no plug in whbasin, and tap loose. Rear room v quiet. Breakfast ok, coffee was brown water, orange juice was orange coloured, Some staff needed deodorant, Do not pay the price for dinner here as the food is not even up to the local cafe standard.and at least 50% too expensive. Hotel in as good a location as is possible. Blue Mosque 200 yard, St Sophia(as it was) 300 yards, Topkapi 400 yards. Grand bazzar 250 yards. The hippadrome runs alongside the Blue Mosque. Tram line stations 125 yards, 1.5 TL for a token which will take you one station or to the end of the line or anywhere in between. View from hotel roof terrace is good. Three other hotels adjacent have better unrestricted views of the Blue M,the St S, and the Topkapi. The Lady Diana, The Golden Horn and the Arcadia

Reviews.Title: “I would always look forward to staying at this fine hotel time and again !”
Reviews.Author: nfl73
Reviews.Content: It was the fourth time I stay at Mina Hotel in less than two years . I love everything about it. The rooms , the staff , the breakfast area, the terrace , the location . One can not ask for more . The room rates are well priced for the service you get at this fine hotel . I highly recomend it .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location! Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: myplaces2c
Reviews.Content: Our painstaking research was well-rewarded with our choice of the Mina Hotel. The location is perfect, tucked away in a quiet side street yet within a few minutes walk of the major historical attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Cisterns, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar), museums, a good selection of bars and restaurants and the very impressive local transport system. The hotel has good facilities including a ground floor lounge, mini gym, a bright top floor restaurant/bar and a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. Free internet access is available to guests (invaluable during our recent unplanned extended stay when the volcano erupted in Iceland!). The rooms are clean and nicely furnished with comfortable beds, satellite television, fridge, hairdryer, safes and some of those on the higher floors have views over the rooftops to the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast, which is served in the 6th floor restaurant, offers an excellent selection of hot and cold dishes in a bright and airy setting. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly especially Ali (on the front desk) for whom nothing is too much trouble. His local knowledge is invaluable and he is happy to make suggestions or reservations as required.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: malf196
Reviews.Content: The location is great for tourists, half way between the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar and convenient for the tramline. The staff were polite and helpful, and the breakfasts were good. The view from the roof terrace was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A place to come back”
Reviews.Author: Ant0nius
Reviews.Content: Through the KLM website we booked the Mina hotel as part of a package deal. The hotel is closely locked near the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet -area) in the city center. Pro's: * Very friendly staff, especially at the reception. Helpful with printing documents, giving directions etc * Very nice roof terras, where you can eat * Wifi connetion is free, but not always stable (too many Wifi hotspots on channel 11, resulting in quite some interference) * Good breakfast at a very reasonable price * Very centrally located, near the major touristic points of attention. Tram transport only 5 minutes walking from the hotel * Nice neighborhood. Con's * Dinner was OK, but not great comparing with other restaurants * Room's are nice, but we had a rather small window.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful..wonderful locationand staff committed to excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Rugaya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated and a stones throw to all major sightseeing attractions and transport. The staff I feel was much more than helpful..giving us the advice that one can only get from locals. All my questions were answered promptly way before I arrived in Istanbul. The breakfast was fresh every morning and the views from the hotel was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff we ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: SwitzerlandEnglish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet and perfectly situated for a city break. We stayed here during the chaos with the volcanic ash from Iceland cancelling ALL flight home! The staff here were simply brilliant! Ali, found us another hotel, then told us they would pay for the taxi to get there. They helped us with getting to and from the airports when we were still trying to get flights. They re-booked us into the Mina when we couldn't get home, at the same rate as we originally stayed (some people we spoke to were charged double to stay in their hotels!).All this was done with friendliness, humor, and pleasure. They were exactly what you needed when you were stranded, and had no real idea of what to do! 5 star people!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, situted central in Sultanahmet, great terrace view allso from the breaktfast restaurant”
Reviews.Author: YveBucharest
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, good location, terrace view from restaurant / breakfast room over the Marmara and Sultanahmet . If weather is good you can enjoy coffee on the terrace. We were every day late at the museums because of this wonderful view. The rooms have tasteful furniture and are well compartimented. Every day clean , every day new lawndry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: rtpaynetx
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The service is excellent. The rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. Wifi is available throughout the hotel. The staff speak English. The restaurant serves great food at reasonable prices.If all this were not enough, it is within walking distance with major monuments in Istanbul. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay here. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Lovely city.”
Reviews.Author: gsgawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, staff were friendly and helpful,rooms were clean cosy and finished to high standards. Plenty of choice for breakfast and as much as you wanted the views were fantastic. Also an added bonus was the roof terrace where we had coffee one morning. The location is handy for sight seeing, we used the trams it was very easy to get around. Turkish people very helpful and like to chat very charming. This is a city I would return to again using the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansDenise
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel in good position with very friendly obliging staff. Great views from roof top bar and breakfast room. Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all round good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: kat1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be an excellent option. We booked due to the location and the price (through Lastminute with cashback through Quidco). Flew to Sabiha Gokcen airport and pre-arranged a transfer with the fantastic Backpackers agency http://www.backpackerstravel.net/index.php?pid=20&id=43 which was 165TL for 4 people - return. On arrival the hotel staff were courteous in checking us in to our rooms, both on 2nd floor, and giving us maps and some local information about excursions (which we did not take but could be arranged for you if you wished). The rooms were small but this was not a concern for a short stay. The bathrooms were excellent with toiletries and big towels. The shower was powerful although as mentioned before the bath is quite high (this would be a problem if you had mobility issues). The beds were the comfiest hotel beds I have slept in with lots of plumped up pillows and a lovely duvet - fab. Whilst the rooms look great some parts are lacking in quality as a phone jack was hanging off the wall, a couple of lights were out and my bed lamp hung at an unusual angle! This was not a concern to me (so did not even report to hotel reception) but I am sure it would be off-putting to others. The breakfast room has a great view, the buffet breakfast is plentiful (eggs, sausage, breads, cheeses, meats, salad, fruit, cereals, yoghurt, cakes, biscuits, preserves, teas, coffee and orange juice (squash) and we very much enjoyed it. Most importantly to us, the hotel is 1 minute walk from the tram (Cemberlitas) which made it easy for us navigate even though we didn't use the trams. It took us 5 mins to walk to the Blue Mosque & Haghia Sophia, the same in the opposite direction to the Grand Bazaar and about 20mins to the Spice Bazaar & Galata Bridge. There are p lenty of shops & dining options along the way too. All round, this is a great choice for a cheap hotel from where you can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: immyParis
Reviews.Content: it is my third trip to istanbul, I know that good hotels there are quite expensive and most of them are in Taksim square ....... BUT : Mina Hotel !! I was really surprised by the quality of this hotel, for 35 Eur / night, you have : - a single room, very well furnished, very clean, very good bathroom - an hotel in an excellent location, near to tram station, restaurants, bazaar .... - a great view in the last floor where the restaurant is : you take your breakfast (good with good varieties of food) while you envoy the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque just in front of you. To sum up : for all my next trips, I can never go to any other hotel !

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: pepiya1999
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice,in the centre of Sulthanameth,near the gran bazaar and the blue mosque.rooms are clean and big!! very very nice

Reviews.Title: “Got off to a bad start and don't accept Room 202”
Reviews.Author: hollow
Reviews.Content: Staff seemed a little confused when we arrived , we had booked through BA and we began to wonder if we had a reservation at all. We were shown to our room which was small, very dark, very hot and had a small obscured window that opened out onto a stair well. The bathroom was small and the grouting was covered in black mould. The water went off mid afternoon and when it came back on it was very brackish and took a while to clear. e asked if we could be moved to another room as the heat was unbearable. The manager told us he had nothing available. The final straw was went the electricity went off due to water coming through the floor above and the second floor was without power. A second request to change rooms still gave the same reply and it was only when we called another hotel to check for vacancies that the manager found us another room as he wanted us to say good things on Trip Advisor"! The second room on the 5th floor although a twin as opposed to a double had a window that looked out over the roof tops towards the sea and we had fresh air coming in. Bathroom was also larger and no mold although the shower over the bath could be difficult for people with mobility problems as the step in and out of the bath was deep. Breakfast was typical continental, cheese, olives etc. orange juice was powdered and coffee from a machine. Having said all of that the linen and towels were changed every day and reception staff helpful. The hotel is very central to all the major sights so it was easy to get around. Mina is a good tourist class hotel and value for money, we paid far less that the rack rate advertised (135 euro for a double). If you want somewhere central then this is a good hotel. Just beware of the internal facing rooms and the second floor!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - value for money hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Just1ne75
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet with spectacular views from the roof terrace. Excellent value for money with friendly and accommoating staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable, all thats required when visiting a city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and i would definately stay at the Mina hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Softgrrl
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online and pictures looked good. Sometimes you can't tell much from photos however, this hotel was a gem. The hotel was very clean. Beds were comfy and bathroom was spotless. Staff treated us very well and were generally helpful with anything we asked about. Breakfast buffet was tasty and varied including local and western style food. Views from hotel were amazing - overlooked the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. Cost of room was very good although it was not considered high season at time we travelled. Location was excellent. Was able to walk to many historical sites. I'll definately stay here again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, welcoming hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: g_n_t_please
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed at the Mina in January for 5 nights. We received a warm greeting and was given a run down on what sights Istanbul had to offer. The hotel recommended an all day excursion, which we subsequently booked, that took in a boat cruise up the Golden Horn and Bosphorous - cable car ride, visit to Dalahambra Palace and lunch included in the price. We had a good day despite the rain and would recommend this trip. The hotel room was small but perfect! The bed was comfy with good sized pillows and crisp, white bed linen. The bathroom was spotless with a good supply of toiletries. Breakfast was served in the rooftop restaurant which was always a good start to the day! There was plenty to choose from - cereals, ham, cheese, croissants, cake etc - enough to set you up for the day. Location was good - just a quick walk away from Tram Street, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Starbucks!! We would recommend Dubb Indian restaurant and also Romelli's which had lovely open fires and good, tasty food - both located within walking distance of the hotel. Had a good trip although if we had to go again I would go in the warmer months!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: BudapestD
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother, the trip I organised as a birthday present for her. We liked the hotel very much, it has perfect location, most of the sights are in walking distance. Breakfast is gorgious, we had very nice see view, and felt safe staying in Mina hotel. Internet wifi access was problematic, we were told it is a modem problem and will be repaired. Be aware that sauna should be paid extra, I thought it is included. We stayed 5 nights, thus we received extras like wine, free dinner, welcome cocktail - you should remind the hotel staff to get it. It is rare to have snow and cold in Istanbul, this time we had it. It was very good we had good heating and warm in our hotel room. All in all the hotel is value for money and we were very much satisfied and would recommend to stay in Mina Hotel. We would choose it next time also! I liked Turkey very much, would come back definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: IsraelCampos
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect, it is a few minuteâ€™s walk to the major attractions (Hyasofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace etc.) The staff was very friendly and helpful. The price is very reasonably. I definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Service was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: writeveronica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mina Hotel for 4 nights at the end of December 2009. The hotel was located in a wonderful location. In less than a 5 minute walk you could get to some wonderful restaurants and in about 10 minutes you could walk to the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel workers were very nice and attentive. There was a slight problem with the shower head and when we remarked about it, it was fixed immediately. We were really impressed with how quickly they attended to the issue. Our hotel room was nicely decorated and provided an appropriate amount of hanging space, etc.

Reviews.Title: “extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: kritsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Old Town area very near the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Topkapi, the Grand Bazaar and at least two famous Turkish baths. Howvever, despite its central location, it was very quiet. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go and when it was too far, all we had to do was hop on the tram. The room was a bit small but we weren't in it much,:it was very clean with a TV and minibar. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the service was very polite. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and would definitely stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning breakfast and terrace views”
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of months ago on a 5 day trip with my boyfriend and was impressed with the hotel. We had booked a double room but was told this was a twin room. We couldn't join the beds together because of a partition between the two so it made for a cosy stay in a single bed. However, we really didn't mind too much as the room was of basic standard and we were hardly in the hotel for we spent most of the time sightseeing. It was a basic, standard double room with a shower/bath which was fine. The building itself is attractive, in particular the lobby and the hotel restaurant/terrace. The highlight was breakfast in the terrace resturant as there was a huge buffet and cooked breakfast to order. Fresh pastries, cereals, fruit and the marble cake was to die for, best I've ever tasted. The breakfast set us up well for a day's sightseeing. We ate out every evening apart from the last when we decided to try out the hotel restaurant on the roof terrace and am glad we did for it was one of the most romantic experiences I've had. The food was very good but it was the view that sold us. Since the hotel is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar, and the hotel has 6/7 floors it meant we had a breathtaking view of the buildings and of the ships passing through the Bosphorous. The atmosphere was electic, candlelit supper and hearing the city rushing past made for a surreal experience. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for it's location, excellent roof terrace, drinks and breakfast offering. If we did go back again, we'd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: eekmouse
Reviews.Content: (6-11 Nov 2009) What a wonderful hotel. The staff are all very friendly, polite and helpful & I found the hotel to be spotlessly clean and very comfortable. My room was large with french windows and a Juliet balcony, beautiful decor, a good sized bathroom and plenty of wardrobe space. I felt at home immediately. The breakfasts are lovely with lots to choose from. The restaurant is very attractive and the roof terrace and views are amazing. There is a lot to see within walking distance; the Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia, Yerebatan (Basilica Cistern), Topkapi...plus lots of restaurants and shops. Also within walking distance are trams, taxis and buses. A great base. I will definitely be back very soon. It was a real pleasure to stay at Mina, thank you very much to all of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hina27
Reviews.Content: The week long stay at this hotel was a very pleasurable experience. The hotel was very clean and was in the ideal location to all of the main attractions, i.e blue mosque, grand bazaar and hagia sophia museum. During the second day of our stay, my mother who suffers from arthritis found it difficult to use the bathroom facilities and asked for a room which had a walk in shower. Within the hour the staff immediately accommodated my mother with a suite on the ground floor with excellent facilities. The gentleman at the reception (forgotten his name) then gave me a suite on the ground floor also. The rooms were exquisite! I would recommend this hotel to families,couples,and friends on holiday. Due to the hotel and staff we had a fantastic stay. Will definitely be going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location; make sure facilities in your room work”
Reviews.Author: Woman_in_Toronto
Reviews.Content: View from their terrace over Marmara Sea and of Blue Mosque is beautiful and they really are 5-10 minutes from Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar, but make sure all the facilities in your room work as soon as you check in. We had a room on a higher floor (fourth floor), with a view of the Marmara Sea (as well as a smaller mosque and various Istanbul buildings) just as we requested. I took a shower and noticed the water was not draining properly. When I called Reception, they said we would have to wait for "Technical Services" the next day. So my friend could take neither a shower nor a bath that night. We also noticed that while the fan came on, no cold air came out. The next morning we re-reported the problem to Reception. When we returned that evening, they said the shower had been fixed and the plug was draining. Around 5:30 pm, the air-conditioning was fixed, and we had air-conditioning for the rest of our stay. That day we both took showers; no problem. The day after my friend took a bath and I noticed the water was leaking into the hall; leaking from bathtub, not that it was overflowing. Also, once again, the plug was stuck in the bathtub. We called Reception who put down towels and said "Technical Services" would fix it in the morning. We pointed out the bath water would continue leaking all night and in fact could leak down to the rooms below. He seemed to think water would not leak through our floor to the rooms below (I don't know why not), but finally at our insistence that he get a knife or something to pry open the plug, he came back with a knife and pried off the plug so at least the water drained through the plug, not into our bathroom. He had to lay down some more towels because the remains of the water still leaked out of the tub but at least it had stopped leaking, and the towels soaked up the water.. The next morning we once again reminded them about the leak and the plug still not draining properly. When we returned the next afternoon, they said the leak was fixed, but seemed to know nothing about the plug draining situation. Luckily, "Technical Services" was there, and my friend took him to our room and pointed out the problem. He did not seem to have been told about it before, but he did fix it properly and efficiently once he was told. So whoever had the room after us, we did you a favour because I suspect the problem had been going on for a while but never fixed properly. We asked for a discount because I can understand one problem with the air-conditioning and one with the plug, but obviously the plug had never been fixed properly the first time. They refused because we were already receiving the Internet discount which was true, but there was nothing to indicate that the Internet discount meant your air-conditioning would not work for the first night, or you would have problems with your shower/bath on two nights. The view from the restaurant is good, and the one from the terrace of the Blue Mosque and the boats in the Marmara Sea is even better. They don't encourage the use of the terrace; you have to carry up all your utensils, serviettes, as well of course your food and coffee and there are no trays. But it is a beautiful view and worth the extra trouble. Our room was pleasantly decorated and the bathroom facilities were all clean and in good condition. The closet was a good size, but few shelves, but that may be standard for Istnabul. The breakfast was plentiful but mediocre; for example, all the bread was stale. We did not have any of the cooked dishes. The location is great. Not only 5-10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque (we are middle-aged ), but also about 5 minutes from Divanyolu Caddesi (also knows as "Tram Street") where not only can you get the tram that goes to the "New European" section of Istanbul across the Galata Bridge, and other "tourist-worthy" destinations in Istanbul, but it has several restaurants (both indoor and outdoor) and bank machines. Also, I knew if I got lost (easy in Istanbul because not a lot of street signs), people could always guide me to "Tram Street". Also within walking stance from Topkapi. All the staff, except for Ali, are friendly and helpful. Two of them speak English quite well, and are helpful in explaining directions. There is a Laundry and Dry Cleaning Service, Amphora Laundry, 53 Peykhane Caddesi, about 3 minutes from the hotel. 5 Turkish Lira a kilo. When come out of the hotel turn right. Turn right immediately at the next street. Go I think it is 1 block down the street (might be two blocks) and turn left on to Peykhane Sok. On left hand side about half way down the block is Amphora Laundry. The owner "Bobby" speaks English well. There is also a "Justice Palace" close by where they sell stamps in the basement. The stamps from vendors can have an up to 40% mark-up. If the hotel orders a taxi for you, be sure to get an estimate of what it should cost. We took a taxi from the airport which was 29 Turkish lira which was within the 28 to 35 Turkish lira that other Trip Advisor writers had said was reasonable from Sultanahmet, especially as it was around 5:00 pm on a weekday. That is about half the 30 Euros Hotel Mina would have charged (about 2 Turkish Lira to a Euro). We also took taxis around the Ortakoy Dolmabahce Palace area which were 7 to 8 Liras each which was reasonable. But when we took a taxi to Chora Church which the Mina ordered for us, I had asked and been told it should be 15 to 20 Turkish Lira. I checked the meter several times on the way and when we were fairly close, it showed about 11 liras so I thought it would be between 15 to 20. When we got there, the driver said it was 40 Turkish Lira, and the meter showed 40. I said I had been told it was 15 to 20, and gave him 20 Turkish lira. He did not protest or argue or even shrug his shoulders. He just took the 20 Lira so he clearly knew he had tried to overcharge me and had somehow changed the meter. Even the 20 TL may have been too much. So always get an estimate if the hotel orders you a taxi and check the meter especially towards the end. The second taxi they ordered did not have his meter on, but he put it on when I asked. He did change his mind about his direction which cost us a couple of extra lira, but my friend thought it was legitimate as we were stuck in traffic and it was still just within the maximum the hotel had told us the taxi would cost. And as I said the taxi we took from the airport, and the taxis we took around Ortakoy were reasonable so not all Istanbul taxi-drivers are dishonest. In spite of the problems with the air-conditioning and the shower, I still recommend the Mina provided you get a price significantly below their list price. For us, the price was 72 Euros for a twin bedded room which for the very convenient location, the nice view from our room, the clean bathroom and pleasantly decorated room, the helpful staff (except for Ali who seemed mainly interested in pushing certain restaurants, etc.) and the great view from the terrace was a good deal. Just make sure everything works as soon as you check in. By the way, the "call to prayer" could be heard very clearly from our room even with the windows closed but I still think it was worth it for the view of the water. It may be quieter on the other side, though it is so loud I don't see how you can not hear it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: snowmansam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 5th anniversary. Wonderful mid-sized hotel, very comfortable rooms and good breakfast. It was easy to get to all the major sights by foot from here however the tram line was nearby if later at night. View from the terrace was amazing and plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “5 minutes from where it's at.”
Reviews.Author: ggbaba
Reviews.Content: 5 nights in this delightful hotel. The staff are courteous and very helpful. The rooms are adequate and clean. Lovely towels changed every day. All the soaps and shampoos etc. We had a view overlooking the river. 5 minutes from The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar restaurants, tramway etc. You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly and helpful staff, clean, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTeviot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and found it to be ideal in terms of value for money, comfortable and quiet rooms (if a little small), responsive and helpful staff, and central location. We broke our stay to go to Gallipoli, and asked for a double bed on our return. In fact, the front desk manager organised an upgrade to a bigger, better room for us - which was much appreciated. The buffet breakfast was consistently excellent - and they arranged a very early breakfast on the day we left for our Gallipoli tour. Only two downsides - (1) the beer and other drinks were not icy cold and (2) the rooftop terrace, whilst affording lovely views over the Blue Mosque, would benefit a lot from some shaded areas.

Reviews.Title: “Charlie's Angels”
Reviews.Author: katpet
Reviews.Content: Wonderful four nights at the Mina Hotel, Ali and staff always on hand to help and give advice. Situated in the Sultanamet with brilliant views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous from the roof terrace. Looking at other reviews, yes the rooms may be small but they are clean, comfortable and are all that you need, after all we were there to explore and enjoy our friends 60th birthday. Would definately recomment this hotel and hope to return next year with family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In The Centre Of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Vicmo9992
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the location of this hotel, it is literally 5 minutes walk from nearly everything you want to see. The rooms were fairly compact but perfect for what I wanted. The resturant had great views over the Blue Mosque and the food was good. Would definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location PLUS”
Reviews.Author: lynx412
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, within minutes of the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc and in the heart of the old City of Istanbul, close to tram and autobus and the main street in Sultanahmet. Stunning views of the Bosphorus, sunrise and sunset from the rooftop bar area and dining room. Breakfast and dinner can also be taken in the rooftop area which has a glorious panoramic view of the City, especially after dark. Caner, our host on arrival at reception was very knowledgeble and gave good advice re places to visit, all hotel staff were very friendly. Free internet access in the reception area was an unexpected bonus. The bedroom was a little dark and not a lot of space if you have large suitcases, we were here for 7 nights, plenty to chose from at breakfast, although pretty much the same every day, lots of fruit, cheeses, breads, choice of eggs, teas and coffees etc. Overall a fantastic boutique style hotel, THANK YOU CANER, regards, Lyn & Shahbaz

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are too small and bathroom is miniscule”
Reviews.Author: wfm48
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend anyone to this hotel as the rooms were very samll and the the breakfast buffet ran out of food and was not replenished. The plus points were it was a great location and within walking distance of most monuments

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LelyK
Reviews.Content: We spent there 3 nights (celebrated my birthday)- and liked everything: very clean and cosy rooms, breakfast on open terrace with breathtaking views of the city&sea. Location is perfect ,managers are very professional and hospitable (special thanks to Mr. Ali Aldemir). We were happy to have some pleasant suprises from the hotel: wine, fruits, transfer to airport :) I'm glad that we stayed at Mina hotel. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “dont hesitate to book thÄ±s hotel”
Reviews.Author: wayne133
Reviews.Content: found thÄ±s hotel on trÄ±padvÄ±sor and am currently stayÄ±ng Ä±n the hotel. Ä±ts been excellent value for money. the rooms are clean and tÄ±dy, have an electronÄ±c safety deposÄ±t box Ä±n the room. the flat screen tv on the wall has bbc and cnn and the bathroom Ä±s well stocked wÄ±th shampoo, shower gel etc. the aÄ±rcondÄ±tÄ±oner works well and the servÄ±ce from all staff Ä±s fÄ±rst rate. the breakfast food selectÄ±on Ä±s ample and very tasty and the restaurant has wonderful vÄ±ews of the harbour. my only complaÄ±nt was the dÄ±nner we had tonÄ±ght Ä±n the restaurant was poor and Ä± wouldnt have dÄ±nner there agaÄ±n. the locatÄ±on Ä±s sensatÄ±onal beÄ±ng so close to the maÄ±n centre but no noÄ±se can be heard once Ä±n the hotel apart from the call to prayer Ä±n the mornÄ±ngs but Ä± have slept through that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, clean well-appointed if rather small rooms, good restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: petetheteach
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fourth floor in a room at the back of the hotel with a view of the Marmara Sea. The room was very clean and was well-equipped with flat screen telly on wall, small fridge, numerous power points, free wi-fi access, safe and even a small sofa. The bathroom had a shower over bath and was very clean and everything worked as it should. A good selection of soaps, shampoos etc. as well as cotton buds, sewing kit and so on. Good tea - and coffee-making facilities, but not always topped up every day with sugar etc. There are tables and chairs on the open-air roof with good views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Marmara Sea and one of the suspension bridges that span the Bosphorous. The restaurant is on the floor below and enjoys great views south towards the Marmara Sea. The food is very good and reasonably-priced, although the choice available for the breakfast buffet is rather limited. The hotel staff throughout are very helpful and friendly and English is widely spoken as are a number of other languages. All the major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance, the Hotel being situated between the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar, and about 120 metres from the tram. Excellent value - a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “All round great service, good value for money and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I found every member of staff extremely efficient, friendly and cooperative. Our room was compact but very comfortable. It was also spotless, pleasantly furnished and pleasingly decorated. It had good facilities and was always well serviced the following day. The meals were very good, well prepared and compared well with eating out. (Eating out could be a bit of a hassle and I had heard of people being taken for a ride when they were offered samples and extras. Always check prices before accepting.) The restaurant is comfortable and has excellent views of the Blue Mosque and coast. Make sure you go to the very top floor which is alfresco and there are even better views. A great staff who work hard to make your stay enjoyable without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Our view - an excellent hotel in a really good position”
Reviews.Author: PhilandJacky
Reviews.Content: We had used Tripadvisor to help us select the Mina Hotel as our base for a 3 day weekend stay in Istanbul and saw the variation in views of some of the previous contributors. All views are subjective, of course, but I am surprised that anyone was dissatisfied with what we found to be a very good - and reasonably priced - hotel. The service was excellent; they had very helpful, friendly and welcoming staff; room cleaning was 1st class and the restraurant/food and breakfasts were also very good (we thought). The hotel is also very near to the main 'attractions' in the Old City but with no noise problems (though you do - of course - hear the calls to prayer from the various mosques near by) - and the roof top terrace has fantastic views overlooking the Blue Mosque, the Haghia Sophia and the rest of the city .......

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandSunseeker
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through lastminute.com after reviewing several hotels in the older part of Istanbul. The hotel is tucked away in a location which is in walking distance of several places of interest ( Mosques / Bazaar / Palace / Underground Cistern etc etc. ) so from a convenience point of view it was perfect. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful and guided us through some of the pre-bookable excursions that were available to us during our short 3 day stay. The hotel itself is spotless with decent accomodation but the biggest plus factors are the views from the restaurant and the rooftop terrace, which are stunning. In one view you can look towards the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, The river Bosphorus with the Bosphorus Bridge in the background as well as the many mosques which dominate the skyline of this intriguing city. The hotel does offer airport transfers which we declined, but if you fly in to Istanbul you should pay no more than 28TL for the transfer to the hotel.
