We took advantage of the return transfer which cost us a hassle free 35TL. The dinner menu is varied and offers good value for money, and the breakfast was substantial. The exchange rate in Istanbul was 2.46 TL to the GBP so we got a little bit more extra value for our money. This hotel delivers everything it says on the box ! and we would certainly recommend it for its location, friendliness of staff and those stunning views.

Reviews.Title: “We love the staff & the location”
Reviews.Author: HermosaBondGirl
Reviews.Content: We love the staff at this hotel. From the moment we walked into the hotel in the early evening, the receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. It was our first experience in Turkey and it really set the tone for our vacation. The location is also great. It is just off the busy roads of Sultanahment, so you have very easy access to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and to the tram, without all of the noise. Make sure you close your windows at night, so you do not hear the early morning call for prayer, unless you want to. The windows are good and solid and block any potential street noise. They have a roof top deck that is not to be missed with clear views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Golden Horn and Bosphorus. We would always have an evening beer 'Efes' before heading out to dinner. It is a perfect place to see the sunset. We also brought our breakfast up there. For Restaurant recommendations: Go to Dubb for Indian food and eat at the top before sunset or for lunch. Great views. Go to Hamdi, which is right across from the New Mosque square. You can see the sign at the top of the building visible from the square. Hamdi has very lean lamb 'sis' kabob with pistachio...a must. Their Turkish pizza with walnuts, pomegranate & minced beef is awesome. (Savory not sweet) Have fun in Turkey! We loved our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: 44hammer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from istanbul and stayed at the hotel Mina.At first we were given a horrible room with no view and a window which looked out onto the stairwell.After a chat with the reception we were soon moved to a much more impressive room with a lovely city view with a superb bathroom and lovely facilities. The staff are extremely helpful and i could not fault the service. Breakfast is immense as is the view from the roof top terrace. I would recommend it to anyone but be sure to specify that your room has a city or ocean view.Good wi-fi connection for those who require it.

Reviews.Title: “Smart choice”
Reviews.Author: Kia37
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation close to blue mosque at the heart of Sultan Ahmet district. We were lucky to get a good deal in high season. Room size is small but well furnished. There's a beautiful roof top and terrace facing the golden horn and the blue mosque; Wonderful night view. The reception staff were polite and room service was acceptable. They also offered us free shuttle service back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Beautiful View on the Sea”
Reviews.Author: OlgaMichigan
Reviews.Content: Mina is a cozy hotel with very nicely decorated interior. Upstairs breakfast area has a magnificent view on the sea. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. Hotel is also very conveniently located in the old city, close to main attractions. We enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PTLS41
Reviews.Content: just returned from istanbul where i stayed at the Mina hotel with my family. I found the staff very helpful and the location very central to all the sights in the sultan ahmet area. It is a 4 star rated hotel and in some instances that is the case but little things can let it down such as the rooms have basic facilities, no trouser presses, no kettles to make a brew etc. Overall i enjoyed my stayed at the hotel and iwould recommend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Would repeat visit.”
Reviews.Author: Aminya
Reviews.Content: Would certainly stay at the Mina again. It is well-priced with breakfast included and a beautiful view from breakfast room, comfotable room cleaned daily with all necessary amenities. The hotel is very well located and close to famous sights. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just great value!”
Reviews.Author: Chispeee
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Minutes from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Cistern etc. Tidy, clean rooms...good shower Despite being central, quiet at night, even facing the road Great rooftop bar Excellent breakfasts Ali at reception...VERY helpful...and can organise the hotel's own airport shuttle Excellent value! Minus: Lack of storage space in the bedroom...strange when they have room for shelves!

Reviews.Title: “I Came Back A Second Time - So It Must Be Good”
Reviews.Author: judijude
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second stay at the Hotel Mina and I have to say that the experience was just as fantastic as the first time. I came last year and was pleasantly surprised at the warmth and helpfulness of the staff. This year was no different. This hotel is perfectly situated for all the main tourist sites - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern etc - they're all within walking distance. The rooms I had - both last year and this- were cleaned to a very high standard every day with fresh towels too! A liitle more space would have been good but, hey, you don't spend all day in your room, do you? And my experience of the air-conditioning was that it worked superbly well. And was much needed as it was really hot last week. The roof terrace is amazing with a fantastic view of The Blue Mosque - especially at night. Jaw droppingly beautiful - especially when it is accompanied by the numerous calls to prayer from the surrounding mosques. And eating breakfast looking out over the Sea of Marmara - well, it doesn't get much better than that. Thanks to all the wonderful staff there - they made my stay a pleasure and a delight Jude Medhurst.

Reviews.Title: “A place to come back to”
Reviews.Author: Rimmer3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, to include the weekend of the Turkish Grand Prix. The hotel staff were very helpful in arranging transport to and from the GP for both days and also with transport to and from Attaturk Airport. Service and rooms were both very good. A huge plus is the excellent terrace restaurant with a breathtaking view of the Bosphorus and both the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia - brilliant at night. And so useful if you didn't want to brave the hundreds of other restaurants in Sultanahmet!!

Reviews.Title: “Quick, but grand”
Reviews.Author: Wanderin2
Reviews.Content: Not a negative to this place. Easy stay, with a breakfast fit for a king!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star staff !! made for an AWESOME stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherMW
Reviews.Content: Compliments where they are due and hats of to Gokhan and Caner the evening staff and to Ali on the desk in the day time FANTASTIC! Despite the lobby being busy when I was there, they ALL took the time to answer patiently all the myriad of questions I presented. The buffet breakfast that is provided is excellent as was the service! For those that complain and say the buffet was sparse, perhaps they should consider arriving earlier!! when the buffet is fully stocked upon opening. The servers in the restauarant always greeted with a smile and a sincere good morning. We stayed in room 401, 2 beds ok size wise, spotless! and a nice view of the Bosphorous. The bathtub tho was a bit high to step up to get into, water pressure excellent and never an issue with hot water. For light sleepers, hint bring ear plugs as the magical and mesmerizing call to prayer around 4 am can come as a surprise on your first morning if not expecting it, I loved it was soooo cool! Sunsets from the roof top terrace with a glass of Raki and watching the lights come up around the Blue Mosque....is STUNNING! The complimentary English and German newspaper in the lobby for guests to read was nice. Internet in the lobby didn't work a few nites but hey, it wasn't the end of the world, and besides, it was a free service provided, so no complaints. Shoppers tip!! The places around the hotel have FAR better prices then what you will be fleeced for at the Grand Bazaar, buy at the little shops around the hotel, more fun bargaining and less pressure. Be sure to pop into the little cafe to the left of the hotel as you exit! Osman is a great guy and alot of fun and makes a wicked Turkish coffee! and delicious shish. We looked at other hotels around the Mina when we were there, and I am soooo glad I decided on the Mina and would DEFINITELY return there no question, on my next trip to Istanbul. The return transfer to the airport after a 5 day stay was most appreciated. Note to management.. Great product, great staff, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very central location”
Reviews.Author: Anet55
Reviews.Content: I just came back after a 5 day stay in Hotel Mina. We were very impressed by the friendly service and great location of the hotel. Do shop around for a good price as we got quite a few different prices from different websites. Being within walking distance of the Cemberlitas tram stop, Hagia Sopia and Blue Mosque, it was perfect for our needs. You could do some sight seeing, and pop into the hotel to freshen up. The staff was extremely helpful and produced a kettle and cups when we pointed out that the booking stipulated that it was available. The view of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace was breathtaking and we enjoyed the breakfast. Try a Turkish pancake at the friendly lady right next to the entrance of the hotel; delicious. If you are traveling from the airport it is extremeiy easy and cheap (3 TL) to use the metro and tram. As you leave the international terminal ask where is the metro. Buy two tickets (looks like coins) of 1.5 TL each. You will need one for the metro and one for the tram. Board the metro and get off at Zuitenburne. Here you catch the tram to Cemberlitas. Turn into the first street next to the stop and then the first to your left. Mina should be on your right. If you get lost, just ask. Most people will be able to direct you. Anet, Johannesburg, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel â€“ shame about the air con!”
Reviews.Author: Bryoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 404 in mid May and found Hotel Mina a perfect base for exploring the amazing city of Istanbul! The room: was a good size, with a large comfortable bed, flat screen TV, small fridge and complimentary safe. The bathroom was large, and the room was thoroughly cleaned everyday. The only downsides were the fact that the over bath shower occasionally fell off its stand and that the air conditioning wasnâ€™t working. We reported this to the hotel staff who told us that it would not be turned on until summer â€“ which was no help to us in 28 degree heat! There was also a strange pillar in the middle of the room which made it seem much smaller than it was. These are the only things that stop the hotel getting 5 stars. The location: perfect, walking distance from most of the sights and a couple of minutes walk from the tram stop, there are also plenty of restaurants nearby - try the Pudding Shop by Sultanahmet tram for cheap, tasty meals and a great atmosphere. Thereâ€™s also a supermarket round the corner from the hotel selling cheap beer and wine. The hotel: all staff were very friendly and eager to help, like some of the other reviewers we organised a car both to and from the hotel which cost 30 euros each way. Iâ€™m sure you can find cheaper but we were prepared to pay the extra for the ease and reliability of booking with Mina. Breakfasts were great with a wide choice of meats, cheeses, fruit, veg and cereals plus tasty coffee and fruit teas. The restaurant also served tasty and reasonable evening meals â€“ again you can find cheaper nearby but after a long days sightseeing this is definitely worth a try. The views: Without a doubt the best thing about Mina is the roof terrace offering fantastic views of the Bosphorous and Blue Mosque both by day and night â€“ the view alone deserves 5 stars! Mina is a reasonably priced, central hotel with amazing views and helpful staff â€“ an almost perfect base for a perfect city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulParisbound
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 405, with a window overlooking the street for a week. Very nice room, queen size bed, plenty of wardrobe space. The bathroom was a good size with a white marble basin, plenty of bench space. Full size bath with shower in the bath and sliding glass doors. Wi-fi is available in the room. The dining room serves meals plus the inclusive breakfasts. We had enough variety of food for the week - cornflakes, eggs, sausages, cheeses, breads, cakes, biscuits, fruit, juice, tea, coffee, cold meats. The roof top area had modern tables, chairs, umbrellas. Drinks and food were reasonably priced. Service was excellent and the manager, Ali Aldehir, and the other concierge were very helpful and spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: SF49er
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel - the location, the staff, the price, the view from the roof, the free wi-fi. The rooms are a bit small but we liked the french windows and the bed was very comfortable. We had a bottle of wine and wanted to drink it on the roof but were told we could not - even though we were happy to pay a corkage fee. That was too bad.

Reviews.Title: “The best manager”
Reviews.Author: SIDSKID
Reviews.Content: Mina Hotel is in a great location. The rooms are clean but well-worn. I'd say it's a tourist or 3-star classification. The buffet breakfast is better than average and the harbor view from the dining room can't be beat. The front desk staff was superb in answering our every question about sites, transportation and custom. Best of all, the manager gave us the name of the best truly Turkish restaurant, which was in the Taksim, where we found ourselves to be the only tourists among well-off Turks. That alone was worth the price of the room!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: danid7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the right spot at the right time and the staff is excellent. The manager Engin knows everyone in the city and pointed us to great places to eat, an excellent rug seller and helped me deal with parking. The staff was very helpful and positive. The view from the restuarant is good, although I wish the terrace bar had been open, as that would have been better. There was one weird thing about our room - every now and again a smell would blow through the open windows, because the aircon was not on in the building, that was rather unpleasant. Overall though I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “We strongly recommend this friendly well located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westhillians
Reviews.Content: Hello to Engin (Front Office Manager) from Aberdeen. We stayed at the hotel from 25th -29th March 2009. Our experience there exceeded our expectations. We found all of the staff helpful and cherrful. At breakfast there was always a good selection. We did not come to Istanbul for English breakfasts but to enjoy the local food. The coffee was the best that we had in Istanbul. We did not have an evening meal in the hotel so can't comment on this. We had room 307 which had just been beautifully refurbished, so much so that we could smell the new carpet. The beds and pillows were comfortable, towels large and soft, and there was a full range of bathroom products always topped up. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of most of Istanbul's top ten attractions. There was a vast choice of places to eat - we particularly enjoyed the Han Restaurant and En La Luna which were within about 5 or 10 minutes walk from the hotel. We think the best way to get to the hotel from the airport is to use a prebooked minibus with Istanbul Airport Shuttle which drops you at your hotel door. It was a reliable and reasonably priced service. It was also cheap to travel across Istanbul on public transport, about 60 pence a journey. There is a small well stocked supermarket just around the corner from the hotel convenient for water, wine, beer, etc. We did attempt to do a trip up the Bosphorus on our own using the local boats but eventually decided that it was easier to take one of the trips organised for sightseers. It was well worth it. It was our first time to Istanbul and the local vendors, restaurateurs are very persistent at trying to get your custom. This can be trying but on the whole they are very pleasant and accept a friendly 'no thank you'. If you are shopping don't forget barter, barter, barter. Thanks to Engin for all your helps, tips, and advice which made for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid range hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: footix
Reviews.Content: Small hotel within walking distance of major tourist sites. Rooms were decent size, well furnished and very clean. Good buffet breakfast in room with view over the city. Rack rates pretty steep so search for good internet prices. Got a really good rate for 2 single rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, well-located”
Reviews.Author: ShannonUk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mina with my teenage son for a few days break. Although the weather was pretty bad, the staff at the hotel made us feel very welcome and gave us the room that I had requested. The room was on the small side, but very cosy and comfortable, with a view to the water and the Blue Mosque. The bathroom was clean with a full-size bath and the heating worked quite effectively. There is a lovely sauna area and huge TV, which we watched the football on downstairs. Contrary to other reviews, we enjoyed the breakfast, which was served on the floor above our room, so some noise could be heard in the mornings. The views from the restaurant/breakfast area are simply stunning. We would stay here again and I will be recommending the Mina to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gazelleboy
Reviews.Content: No complaints really, especially given the great rates I was paying. Flat screen tvs in every room, and the room was kept very clean. Management extremely friendly and helpful. The dining room offered a fantastic panoramic view of the Bosphorus, that saw me take breakfast even when I wasn't hungry. Location-wise the place is perfect, and a stone's throw from the tramline and many of the major sights. NB. If any of the management get around to reading this, I lost a ring somewhere in my room. I could arrange for someone to pick it up if you were to hold it for me. I was in room 703, and checked out 09/03/09.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HarryAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mina for three nights, and had a wondorful time. The stuff in general have been very helpful and friendly. The location is purfect since it is only a few minutes walk from Ayia Sofia, the blue mosque, and topkapi. Overall we had a very pleasant stay, and we would definately recomend Hotel Mina to friends visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: BocasDatca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Mina and found the staff helpful and friendly. We arrived early in the morning after an 18 hour bus ride from Datca and, although it was t oo early to book into our room, we were provided with coffee and comfort until we could go to our room. The room was fine and cleaned every day by a charming lady and the only fault I can think of was probably due to our feeling so tired after the journey that we misread the price for the Economic Menu as being in Turkish Lira and not Euros, which was a bit of a disappointment. I think that people who are moaning about the hotel are expecting more than a reasonably priced hotel should be expected to offer. The breakfast was wonderful and the views from the breakfast room were marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagrick
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of the Sultanahmet district in Istabul, this Hotel is extremely well maintained, the staff are courteous and friendly, and the decor is very attractive. Our room was quiet and had an excellent bathroom. The included breakfast was outstanding, allowing us to make a Turkish breakfast, or something more North American. Easy to find, just one block off the tram line, and a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, and the Aya Sofia. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: xxlta2005
Reviews.Content: I must addmit I had some bad feelings about visiting Istanbul and despite sharing the same geographical area it was my first time in this marvelous city. Mina Hotel was the first thing to change my mind, through its warm personnel, nice location and overall great room. It is a small nice boutique hotel located on Pierre Loti Str into the old Sultanahmet area of the city. My wife and I were there in Dec. 2008 between 24th and 30th. My wife booked the room and directly with them and got a fair price, from what I have seen. Room (404) was OK - very clean - cleaned daily - with a simple but cozy design. We were facing the city and thus had a double bad. Rooms facing Bosphorus seem to have only twin beds(I am not quite sure of this, though).Bathroom may need a little bit of refurbishing - nothing important just details and could be used as it is. Some people may be annoyed by the mosque behind the hotel as you can hear the prayer 6 times a day. We weren't as our room was facing the opposite side. Breakfast was good for one week we have spent there but could become boring for longer periods of time, as it was the same everyday. Nevertheless if you want variety you can order extra. As the food was not our first priority I can not consider this a minus. The dining hall - restaurant and terrace, during the summer, are located on top of the hotel and have a magnificent Bosphorus view. We also liked the location - max 10 min walking distance from Blue Mosque, St Sophia or Grand Bazaar and close to the tram station - which can get you almost everywhere in Istanbul. I recommend to check hotel's web site for various packages they can offer as we really got a good deal for our stay there. For travellers: please consider tipping (10% should be the max) as this is widely accepted everywhere in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Bobreviews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple stayed for 6 nights at the Mina Hotel in October, 2008. We had rooms of good size for Europe,overlooking the Mamarra Sea, which were kept very clean. The complimentary breakfasts was good, with enough variety to satisfy most tastes. The view of Istanbul from the roof top patio was excellent. The Mina is in the Sultanahmet in the old part of Istanbul and within walkling distance of the Highlight sites- Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Topokai Palace. As well it is close to the tram system. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly stay there again. Bob Edmonton, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SonomaJudy
Reviews.Content: We loved this wonderful hotel. The service was great, the location is perfect - so close to the historic sights of Sultanahmet -, delicious food for breakfast and dinner, a great view from the top deck, and a good price. We recommend this to everyone for all of the above reasons. We will definitely stay here again if we get back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: maremosso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the historic area of Sultanhamet, at a few walking distance from the tram stop. This is the great fact of the hotels in this area, this is behind the Blue Mosque. What is great is the view from the restaurant / breakfast room, at the 6th floor of the building from which you'll see the Marmara see and (laterally) the Blue Mosque. I would have expected a better view from my "Marmara room" which had effectively a view on the Marmara see... but just after the building that was the real view from the room. I was also a little disappointed by the fact that a room with sea view can't have a double bed so me and my wife had to sleep separately... The room was clean and nice. The breakfast is nice, but not particularly rich. I can suggest this hotel for someone who does not want to have bad surprises, but the next time I'll visit Istanbul I'll try a new one.

Reviews.Title: “small, clean with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Yerdeh
Reviews.Content: we got the rooms for extra cheap on a deal we saw online and for that we got the rooms with the windows facing the staircase, so we didn't have any daylight streaming into our rooms! Having said that the rooms were clean and tidy, and the beds were comfortable thought the rooms were a bit small. We weren't too fussed as we spent most of our day wandering around Istanbul anyway. The best thing about the hotel was the concierge/receptionist! We forgot his name but he had glasses on and was rather tall but he was really really helpful and even called up the taxi company that brought us to the hotel to tell them off (the driver demanded for a tip which they shouldn't have done). We got food poisoning on the way back from Cappadocia, and the girls had to stay indoors. There wasn't a spare hotel room we could book & we were too sickly to go anywhere but the concierge let us stay in the conference room to watch tv on the sofas and got us tea for free! Well, I thought that was nice because they could have just told us to bother someone else. Location-wise you can't fault it! View from the hotel breakfast room was great! Breakfast itself was a bit bland but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Avg Room”
Reviews.Author: Bozzza
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for better front desk service, help and advice. Admittedly booking for a cheaper room price, got small rooms with a tiny window facing inside the hotel. Aircondition was erratic although needed in the heat. Breakfast was fine with views from top level to mosques and river. Would recommend but maybe best not for cheaper rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mina
HotelInfo.Address: 6 Dostluk Yurdu Sokak | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
